The armor is the trademark of the Nightingales, a shadowy faction dedicated to the service of the Daedric Prince Nocturnal.
The piece bears an enchantment, the magnitude of which is dependent on character level.
Nightingale Boots offer great synergy while burning. Alternativly they keep your feet warm while asleep.
Nightingale Gloves are not reflective at all, or are they?

+10 Slash Attack Bonus and 5% chance to take no damage from any attack.
A legendary sword, said to be imbued with the power of divine protection. Its radiant glow brings hope to allies and strikes fear into the hearts of enemies.
Forged in the abyss, Sinweaver is a dark blade that hungers for the essence of its foes. Its malevolent aura instills fear and despair in those who face it.
Forged in the fires of Rugdumph's Forge, this sword bears the mark of the legendary blacksmith Rugdumph. Its craftsmanship is renowned for its durability and resilience.
Forged in the crucible of bitterness, this spear carries the echoes of vengeful spirits. Its piercing strikes bring forth the bitter mercy of the fallen.
Crafted from the essence of frigid monarchs, this blade is imbued with the chilling power of ice. Its frozen strikes can freeze the hearts of even the bravest foes.
Forged from the bones of ancient beasts, the Skull Crusher is a formidable mace that instills terror in the hearts of its foes. Its crushing blows leave a path of destruction.
Crafted for the mighty giants of Skyrim, this colossal club can crush foes with a single swing. The sheer force behind each blow is enough to send even the bravest warriors flying.

The armor is adorned with intricate designs, reflecting the craftsmanship of its creators and the prestige associated with its ownership. Lord's Mail has become a symbol of nobility and strength, sought after by warriors and adventurers alike.
Known for their distinctive appearance, the Fists of Randagulf are adorned with runes and intricate patterns, hinting at the potent enchantments that lie within.

The Boots of the Apostle are a rare and revered pair of footwear, steeped in mystique and associated with divine power. Crafted with exquisite precision, these boots are known for their ethereal glow and the symbols of ancient scrolls intricately embroidered upon their surface.

The Vampiric Ring is a mysterious and dark artifact that seem to pulse with an otherworldly energy. Crafted in the shadows and steeped in the essence of the night, this ring is said to be a conduit to the powers of vampirism.

Once donned, the Helmet of Oreyn Bearclaw becomes a symbol of the wearer's connection to the heroic legacy of the past. Whether standing against the forces of darkness or leading comrades into battle, the wearer becomes a living testament to the indomitable spirit of Oreyn Bearclaw and the enduring strength encapsulated within this storied piece of headgear.
In the homes of those who appreciate the unconventional, Goblin Furnishings serve as conversation starters and reminders of the wild and unpredictable nature of Tamriel.
Cooked Juvenile Mudcrab, Light Rune, Magic Bones, Frost Arrows, Enchanted Sapphire Bolts +200. Cooked Juvenile Mudcrab Perfect +100.
Sweetroll + 300, Light Rune +1000, Magic Bones +2000, Fire Arrows +500, Enchanted Ruby Bolts +500.
Mortar And Pestle, Retort, Calcinator, Alembic +100.
Contains a basic wand and a set of green wizard clothes.
Contains a basic wand and a set of blue wizard clothes.
Contains a basic wand and a set of red wizard clothes.

items.name: King Olaf's Verse
items.customDescription: A very faded copy of the fabled work of the bard, Svaknir which is requested by the headmaster of the Bards College, Viarmo. The only remaining copy is sadly, mostly illegible.

items.customDescription: A stinky smell goblin ear.

items.name: Eye

items.name: Goblin Furnishings
items.customDescription: A collection of peculiar goblin decorations and furnishings.

items.name: Elsweyr Spiced Tea
items.customDescription: Elsweyr Spiced Tea is a delightful blend from the province of Elsweyr. The aromatic tea invigorates the mind and body, offering a subtle mix of exotic spices and calming herbs.

items.name: Hagraven's Claw
items.customDescription: A talon from a powerful hagraven, known for its dark magical properties.

items.name: Black Hand Hood

items.name: Scales of Pitiless Justice
items.customDescription: Increase damage while target is fully healed by 50%, +10 melee strength bonus however +10% more damage taken.

items.name: Thieves Orders
items.customDescription: Progression guide

items.name: Dead Drop Orders #7

items.name: Dead Drop Orders #5
items.customDescription: Orders to kill a traveling Dark Elf called Alval Uvani.

items.name: Dead Drop Orders #4
items.customDescription: The execution warrant for an Argonian hunter named Shaleez.

items.name: Dead Drop Orders #3
items.customDescription: Instructions to kill a Khajiit nobleman called J 'Ghasta.

items.name: Dead Drop Orders #2
items.customDescription: The death warrant for an entire family.

items.name: Dead Drop Orders #1
items.customDescription: The order for the death of the necromancer Celedaen

items.name: Boots of Bloody Bounding
items.customDescription: +10 Slash Attack Bonus and 5% chance to take no damage from any attack.

items.name: Shadowhunt
items.customDescription: Increase damage while target is fully healed by 100% and deal a flat damage increase of 40 while the target is fully healed.

items.name: The Five Tenets
items.customDescription: A member of the Dark Brotherhood must follow 5 rules known as 'The Five Tenets'. If they break one, they will need to defeat 'The Wrath of Sithis' to return to the Dark Brotherhood.

items.name: Golden ShipModel
items.customDescription: Shiney.

items.name: Golden Urn
items.customDescription: Shiney.

items.name: Jeweled Pitcher
items.customDescription: Shiney.

items.name: Jeweled Goblet
items.customDescription: Shiney.

items.name: Jeweled Flagon
items.customDescription: Shiney.

items.name: Jeweled Candlestick
items.customDescription: Shiney.

items.name: Waterfront Raid Fails!
items.customDescription: The Black Horse Courier is Cyrodiil's only newspaper.

items.name: Wabbajack
items.customDescription: And as for you, my little mortal minion... feel free to keep the Wabbajack. As a symbol of my... Oh, just take the damn thing.

items.name: Skull of Corruption
items.customDescription: What a foul and unnatural weapon you wield, never have I seen its like.

items.name: Sanguine Rose
items.customDescription: I  never thought to see this again. I once possessed it, briefly ... a lifetime ago, it seems now ... To obtain it, and then give it up... I honor your dedication to our cause.

items.name: Mace of Molag Bal
items.customDescription: The Mace of Molag Bal! I give you its true power, mortal. When your enemies lie broken and bloody before you, know that I will be watching.

items.name: Mehrunes' Razor
items.customDescription: You found my razor. Good. Can you feel its hunger? Can you feel its..Frustration? Now I will make it again what it once was, what it shall always be. Draw a line of blood across the land in the name of Mehrunes Dagon!

items.name: Daedric Crescent
items.customDescription: Probably the most rare and even outlawed item of all the great prizes is the Daedric Crescent Blade.

items.name: Lost Box
items.customDescription: A box that must of fallen of the back of a ship on the way to Melvor.

items.name: Sigil Stone
items.customDescription: A Sigil Stone is the object that keeps Oblivion Gates open. They are found inside the Sigilium Sanguis, at the top of the largest tower, in the planes of Oblivion.

items.name: Fearstruck
items.customDescription: High stats but takes more damage from dragon breath.

items.name: Sweetroll
items.customDescription: Sweetrolls, sometimes spelled as Sweet Rolls, are a confectionery food. They are pastries with a light brown sweetbread as the lower part, with icing covering the top. Sweetrolls are typically made from milk, flour, butter, eggs, and salt. In Skyrim they resemble a Gugelhopf cake.

items.name: Elder Scrolls
items.customDescription: The Elder Scrolls are artifacts of unknown origin and quantity, being simultaneously archives of historic, past and future events. This one must be faulty, it drops random items.

items.name: Loot
items.customDescription: A box that is full of Elder Scrolls loot.

pets.name: Adoring Fan
pets.customDescription: By Azura, by Azura, by Azura! It's the Grand Champion! I can't believe it's you! Standing here! Next to me!

pets.name: Haskill
pets.customDescription: You approach the Shivering Isles. Through the door behind me lies the realm of Sheogorath, Prince of Madness, Lord of the Never-There.

pets.name: Scamp
pets.customDescription: Scamps are weak enemies who serve Mehrunes Dagon and are usually found in the realms of Oblivion.

pets.name: Felldir the Old
pets.customDescription: Alduin escaped us long ago. Today we take our well-tempered revenge.

pets.name: Shadowmere
pets.customDescription: Why don't you hold onto Shadowmere a while longer? He's a fine steed, and hasn't been ridden nearly as much as he should lately.

pets.name: Undead Ayleid
pets.customDescription: Undead Ayleid smells of something other then flowers.

pets.name: The Goblin Army
pets.customDescription: May the Goblin Army protect you from Assassins

pets.name: Esmerelda
pets.customDescription: What? Esmerelda, with the dark feathers?

altSpells.name: Burden
altSpells.description: Cast Burden on Leaping Trout so they cannot leap, turning them into Raw Trout. How? Magic.
